newsitem.title: FRANCE: ONIC sees French 96 wheat crop at 33.8 mln T - trade.
newsitem.headline: ONIC sees French 96 wheat crop at 33.8 mln T - trade.

text.p: The French grain office ONIC expects France to harvest a record 1996 soft wheat crop of 33.8 million tonnes against 29.8 million tonnes in 1995, grain trade sources said on Wednesday.
The estimate, prepared for release next Wednesday, also targets the 1996 barley crop at 9.36 million tonnes against 7.74 million tonnes in 1995, they said.
The maize crop is seen rising to 13.6 million tonnes from 12.4 million tonnes in 1995.

The draft figures, drawn up ahead of ONIC's monthly meeting on September 11, assume the national soft wheat yield will rise to a record 7.07 tonnes per hectare from 6.60 tonnes in 1995. The previous record for French soft wheat yields was 6.82 tonnes reached in 1991.
The soft wheat area was seen rising to 4.78 million hectares from 4.52 million hectares.

ONIC's estimate, the first since the soft wheat harvest started on July 14, well exceeds previous record highs of 32.65 tonnes in 1984 and 32.05 million tonnes in 1991 before the onset of the reform of the Common Agricultural Policy (CAP).
